prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: DeBord Mills Flour Bags, Mss. Collection 2009.6, Kegley Library, Wytheville Community College, Wytheville, VA

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Provenance is unknown; items were discovered in collection without provenance data.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: DeBord Mill, located in Rural Retreat, Virginia was owned and operated by Joseph Byron DeBord (1921-1964) and his wife Martha Brown DeBord. DeBord also had a mill in Johnson City, Tennessee circa 1930s and a farm in Rural Retreat, Virginia. DeBord died on 11 September 1964 from wounds suffered in a farming machine accident. He was born on 28 July 1921 and married Martha Brown in 1948. The actual start date and end date of the mill's operation is not known.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of five flour bags stamped with DeBord Mills on the cover.

did.physdesc: paper flour bag; mounted on board with plastic cover.

scopecontent.p: Enriched White Dot HIghest Quality Flour, DeBord Mills, Rural Retreat, Va., 2 lb white bag.
